comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content: I think this is the French operatic star Vanni Marcoux (1877-1962). Born Jean-Émile Diogène Marcoux in Turin, Italy, he became a French citizen, and joined the Paris Opera Company in 1912. He later performed with the Chicago Opera Company and the Boston Opera Company. He married his third wife, the dancer Madeline Morlay on July 4, 1914, in Paris. In October, 1914, it was erroneously reported in the press that Marcoux had been killed in the French Army at the outset of WW1. [1] [2] [3] Mrs. J.C. Fairchild [photographer] was a photographer in Boston, with studios at 384 Boylston Street. [4] [5]
